oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to Harry Burn from Mother
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Seven page letter from Febb Ensminger Burn of Niota, Tennessee (Mrs. James L. Burn) to her son Harry T. Burn, urging him to vote for ratification. August 1920. He credits the influence of his mother for changing his vote to support female suffrage. His vote broke the tie in the Tennessee legislature, causing Tennessee to pass the amendment. Tennessee was the 36th state to ratify the Nineteenth Amendment, making it the law of the land.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Suffrage; Correspondence; Political participation; Families;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Febb Burn
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Letter to Harry Burn from Mother, August 1920
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
